books.title: Javascript Enlightenment
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.info: An accurate JavaScript worldview through an examination of native JavaScript objects and supporting nuances.

books.title: Eloquent Javascript
books.author: Marijn Haverbeke
books.info: A book providing an introduction to the JavaScript language and programming in general.

books.title: Building A JavaScript Framework
books.author: Alex Young
books.info: best Of Let’s Make a Framework articles.

books.title: JS in ten minutes
books.author: Spencer Tipping
books.info: This guide is for anyone who knows some Javascript but would like a quick intro to its advanced features.

books.title: Smooth CoffeeScript
books.author: E. Hoigaard
books.info: An introduction to CoffeeScript programming with an emphasis on clarity, abstraction and verification.

books.title: Node Beginner
books.author: Manuel Kiessling
books.info: The aim of the book is to get you started with developing applications with Node.js, teaching you everything you need to know about 'Advanced' JavaScript along the way.

books.title: Up and Running with Node.js
books.author: Tom Hughes-Croucher
books.info: Discover NodeJS APIS, tools, modules and best practices and learn how to extend it.

books.title: jQuery Fundamentals
books.author: Rebecca Murphey
books.info: Community driven Javascript and jQuery book.

books.title: Developing Backbone.js Applications
books.author: Addy Osmani
books.info: In this book we will explore MVC theory and how to build applications using Backbone's models, views, collections and routers.

books.title: Javascript Guide
books.author: Mozilla Developer Network
books.info: JavaScript is a cross-platform, object-based scripting language. This guide explains everything you need to know about using JavaScript.

books.title: JavaScript For Cats
books.author: Max Ogden
books.info: An in-browser interactive introductory programming text designed for cats. Humans are probably also capable of following along.

books.title: Javascript Design Patterns
books.author: Addy Osmani
books.info: In this book we will explore applying both classical and modern design patterns to the JavaScript programming language

books.title: Writing Modular JavaScript With AMD, CommonJS & ES Harmony
books.author: Addy Osmani
books.info: In this article, we're going to look at three formats for writing modular JavaScript: AMD, CommonJS and proposals for the next version of JavaScript, Harmony.

books.title: The little Book on CoffeeScript
books.author: Alex MacCaw
books.info: This book is designed to help you learn CoffeeScript, understand best practices and start building awesome client side applications.

books.title: Master Space and time with JavaScript - The Basics
books.author: Noel Rappin
books.info: [NOTE : Free registration needed]. A four book series aimed at developers who have a basic knowledge of JavaScript but who need to learn about newer tools and practices.

books.title: HTML Canvas Deep Dive
books.author: Josh Marinacci
books.info: For those who allready know JavaScript basics and wants to learn HTML Canvas.

books.title: Dynamisez vos sites web avec JavaScript !
books.author: Le Site du Zero
books.info: [IN FRENCH] Le tutorial référence en francais pour apprendre le JavaScript. Culte !

books.title: Testing with CoffeeScript
books.author: Jack Franklin
books.info: [NOTE : Download needed]. You will be guided through the creation of a shopping cart system. You’ll learn about using and testing jQuery code, writing more idiomatic CoffeeScript and building a well thought out and structured, complex JavaScript application.

books.title: The Past, Present, and Future of JavaScript
books.author: Axel Rauschmayer
books.info: [NOTE : Free registration needed] Historical JavaScript milestones and an overview of ECMAScript.next, the next version of JavaScript.

books.title: Dive into HTML 5
books.author: Mark Pilgrim
books.info: A community ebook to discover HTML5 best practices and experiment with Javascript.

books.title: Javascript Garden
books.author: Ivo Wetzel
books.info: A collection of documentation about the most quirky parts of JavaScript.

books.title: The little MongoDB book
books.author: Karl Seguin
books.info: Discover NoSQL with MongoDB and commons Javascript usage patterns.

books.title: Mixu's Node book
books.author: Mikito Takada
books.info: A comprehensive and interesting NodeJS overview covering many aspects in details.

books.title: Single page apps in depth
books.author: Mikito Takada
books.info: Learn the best practices for implementing single page web apps.

books.title: Mastering NodeJS
books.author: TJ Holowaychuk
books.info: In Mastering Node we will discover how to write high concurrency web servers,…

books.title: JS The Right Way
books.author: William Oliveira
books.info: An easy-to-read, quick reference for JS best practices, accepted coding standards, and links around the Web.

books.title: Building Browser Apps with Google Chrome
books.author: Andy Sylvester
books.info: How to write standalone packaged applications for the Google Chrome browser using Javascript. The book will teach you how to build and test an application through a step by step process.

books.title: Single page apps in depth
books.author: Mikito Takada
books.info: This free book is the book I would have wanted when I started working with single page apps. It's not an API reference on a particular framework, rather, the focus is on discussing patterns, implementation choices and decent practices.

books.title: Programmin Windows 8 Apps
books.author: Devon Musgrave
books.info: [NOTE : Download needed]This book is about writing Windows Store apps using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.

books.title: CoffeeScript Cookbook
books.author: Multiple Owner
books.info: CoffeeScript recipes for the community by the community.

books.title: DOM Enlightenment
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.info: Exploring the relationship between JavaScript and the modern HTML DOM

books.title: JavaScript Applications
books.author: Eric Elliott
books.info: Take your existing JavaScript skills to the next level and learn how to build complete web scale or enterprise applications that are easy to extend and maintain.

books.title: Bootstrap, Responsive Web Development
books.author: Jake Spurlock
books.info: Discover how easy it is to design killer interfaces and responsive websites with the Bootstrap framework. This practical book gets you started building pages with Bootstrap’s HTML/CSS-based tools and design templates right away. You’ll also learn how to extend your app with interactive features, using its suite of jQuery plugins—often without writing a single line of code.

books.title: Art of Node
books.author: Max Odgen
books.info: a free short e-book that teaches you the fundamentals of Node.js by Max Odgen, a popular Node supporter

books.title: Stream handbook
books.author: James Halliday (substack)
books.info: a free short e-book that teaches you how to write node programs with streams, by James Halliday a famous NodeJS supporter that published numerous awesome NodeJS modules

books.title: JavaScript Succinctly
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.info: JavaScript Succinctly was written to give readers an accurate, concise examination of JavaScript objects and their supporting nuances, such as complex values, primitive values, scope, inheritance, the head object, and more. If you’re an intermediate JavaScript developer and want to solidify your understanding of the language, or if you’ve only used JavaScript beneath the mantle of libraries such as jQuery or Prototype, this is the book for you.

books.title: jQuery Succinctly
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.info: jQuery Succinctly was written to express, in short-order, the concepts essential to intermediate and advanced jQuery development. Its purpose is to instill in you, the reader, practices that jQuery developers take as common knowledge. Each chapter contains concepts essential to becoming a seasoned jQuery developer.

books.title: Knockout.js Succinctly
books.author: Ryan Hodson
books.info: Knockout.js Succinctly is intended for professional web developers who need to build dynamic, scalable user interfaces with minimal code. Author Ryan Hodson guides you through the essentials of the library, starting with a brief overview of Knockout and its data-oriented aspects, followed by a thorough examination of binding data to various HTML elements, and finally examples of accessing external data and combining Knockout with jQuery animation routines.

books.title: TypeScript Succinctly
books.author: Steve Fenton
books.info: With TypeScript Succinctly by Steve Fenton, you will learn how TypeScript provides optional static typing and classes to JavaScript development, how to create and load modules, and how to work with existing JavaScript libraries through ambient declarations. TypeScript is even significantly integrated with Visual Studio to provide the autocompletion and type checking you are most comfortable with.

books.title: AngularJS Fundamentals in 60 minutes
books.author: Dan Wahlin
books.info: This eBook is a documented transcription of the famous 'AngularJS in 60 minutes' video; The ebook is going through all of the key fundamentals you need to know about the AngularJS SPA framework.

books.title: Basic JavaScript for the impatient programmer
books.author: Dr. Axel Rauschmayer
books.info: A complete blog post enables you to get started with JavaScript as quickly as possible – if you already know how to program. It describes the smallest subset of the language that allows you to be productive. I call that subset “Basic JavaScript” and recommend to program in it for a while, before moving on to more details and advanced topics.

books.title: Learn.js: a guidebook to building projects with javascript
books.author: Seth Vincent
books.info: You've already learned the basics of the language, now you need to level up on the tools commonly used in building projects with javascript.

books.title: JavaScript Allonge
books.author: Reginald Braithwaite
books.info: JavaScript Allongé is a book about programming with functions, because JavaScript is a programming language built on flexible and powerful functions.

books.title: jQuery Enlightenment
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.info: A book for jQuery developers who have surpassed the introductory concepts.

books.title: D3 Tips and Tricks
books.author: Malcolm Maclean
books.info: Over 430 pages of tips and tricks for using d3.js, one of the leading data visualization tools for the web. It's aimed at helping people get started and also includes loads of help for more complicated tasks.

books.title: JavaScript and Node FUNdamentals
books.author: Azat Mardanov
books.info: A Collection of Essential Basics.

books.title: Recipes with Angular.js
books.author: Frederik Dietz
books.info: Practical concepts and techniques for rapid web application development

books.title: Speaking Javascript
books.author: Axel Rauschmayer
books.info: Like it or not, JavaScript is everywhere these days—from browser to server to mobile—and now you, too, need to learn the language or dive deeper than you have. This concise book guides you into and through JavaScript, written by a veteran programmer who once found himself in the same position.
